trial_identification.studytitle: An online educational program to assist shy people to understand social anxiety and seek help.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A pilot randomised controlled trial to evaluate the effect of an online shyness information program on the help seeking intentions of adults with social anxiety.

interventions.interventions: A single module information website comprising information about social anxiety and feedback about the participant's level of social anxiety. The module will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will be completed in one session.
interventions.comparator: A wellbeing/health information website focusing on physical activity information. No information on anxiety is included. The module is of a similar length to the Intervention module and will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete. It will be completed in one session.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Help seeking intention as measured by General Help-seeking Questionnaire (GHSQ).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Help seeking attitudes as measured by the Attitudes to Seeking Professional Psychological Help Scale-Short Form (ATSPPH-SF): 3 items only (adapted)
Perceived need for treatment for social anxiety (single item). 5 point likert scale.
Help seeking intention as measured by response to an invitation to access an online evidence based self help intervention.
Social anxiety knowledge as measured by the S-Lit
Internalised social anxiety stigma as measured by the SASS

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Participants who self report shyness. Main data analysis to be undertaken on those scoring above cutoff for caseness on the Social Phobia Anxiety Inventory (SPIN >=19). A second data analysis will be undertaken on those scoring above the cutoff score for Batterham's Social Phobia Scale (SOPHS).

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: National Institute for Mental Health Research, Research School of Population Health, The Australian National University 63 Eggleston Crescent, Acton, Canberra, ACT. 2601

fundingsource.fundingaddress: National Institute for Mental Health Research, Research School of Population Health, The Australian National University 63 Eggleston Crescent, Acton, Canberra, ACT. 2601

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A pilot randomised controlled trial to evaluate the effect of an online shyness information program on the help seeking intentions of adults with social anxiety. The primary aim of the study is to collect data that will demonstrate the feasibility of the recruitment procedures and inform the design of an appropriately powered trial.
